2010-08-21 19:08:00 -0400 August Vern from Ohio wonders if he really destroyed his wife's sister's husband's minivan, and, whether it matters, since he's not related to the guy? Also, a close call at Car Talk Plaza reaffirms the value of goofing off; an expectant Mini owner worries about past encounters with shifters; and some ways for Tommy to get out of trouble next time he likens his wife to a truck. Car Talk #1034: He's Nothin' to Me https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129347900/npr_129347900.mp3?e=129347900&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129347900&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129347900/npr_129347900.mp3?e=129347900&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129347900&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer 2010-08-14 19:08:00 -0400 August
2010-08-14 19:08:00 -0400 August A gift keeps on giving--an awful stench, after Annette from Alaska leaves a bag of king crabs in her Mercedes overnight. Also, after decades of sleepless nights, tow truck driver Franks tries to find out what made a car explode on the freeway; a bride-to-be discovers a toilet brush be her best weapon in a driving dispute with her fiance; and, Ray's new $1,000,000 idea--undercover salesmen! Car Talk #1033: A Huge Bag of Crab https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129201238/npr_129201238.mp3?e=129201238&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129201238&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129201238/npr_129201238.mp3?e=129201238&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129201238&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer 2010-08-07 19:08:00 -0400 August
2010-08-07 19:08:00 -0400 August A few cruel (and funny) practical jokes submitted by our listeners. Also, what a failing clutch master cylinder has in common with Ray's dental work, an impatient Boston driver seeks a 2-horn solution to rush hour, and on Stump the Chumps we find out if Sarah's minivan was indeed the site of a peeing contest in her absence. Car Talk #1032: Practical Jokes https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129051732/npr_129051732.mp3?e=129051732&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129051732&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/129051732/npr_129051732.mp3?e=129051732&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=129051732&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer

item.description: Childhood writings by our Technical Advisor John Bugsy Lawlor offer a glimpse of the man he'd become, and give our hosts the chance to laugh--a lot. Also, is wanting to start your car without whacking the fuel pump asking too much? Or, wanting your door to close without the use of rope? And, a Creative Writing class exercise shows a very deep failure to communicate.
item.title: Car Talk #1031: Bugsy's Letters From Camp

item.description: We kick off with a few international sports team names that never caught on, for some reason. Also, critters are chewing on Devon's Jeep, but the solution be as close as her baby's diaper; a husband learns the cost of making his wife drive a mini-van while he tools around in a Lexus, and a well worn Car Talk answer makes a return appearance.
item.title: Car Talk #1030: The New Delhi Catessens

item.description: Tom and Ray's pal learns the horrible truth about what happened to his Lincoln on a snowy night. Also, mechanics pass up a chance to save a life and get a boat payment, a minivan owner tries to sex up his ride, and does a spark plug warning not to regap count if it's not in all capital letters?
item.title: Car Talk #1029: The Pep's Lincoln

item.description: Male solidarity goes down for the count in a marital dispute over parking brake methodology. Also, Nissan owner Scott tries to start his truck and save himself from helpful neighbor Fat Tony and his big bucket o' tools; Heather in New York turns into a hostile witness; and, on Stump the Chumps, did Tom and Ray help Howard get his mattress to Hunga Dunga?
item.title: Car Talk 1028

item.description: Should Mary in Minnesota tell prospective buyers of her Accord that it likely needs a new water pump? Can two mechanics handle this ethical dilemma, or will outside intervention be needed? Also, Male Answer Syndrome comes to mountain driving, a convertible owner develops a ballet worthy of Balanchine to get his top up and down, and on Stump the Chumps, did Tom and Ray correctly diagnose a truck's non-mother in law related shimmy?
item.title: Car Talk 1027

item.description: Tom and Ray triage an epidemic of men behaving badly, including one husband who scratched his wife's car, and then told her it was her fault. Also, further evidence that our Producer Dougie Berman is a bad influence, a budding bassist gets to choose between a Ford Freestyle and pair of Clark Wallabees, and a graduation gift that will keep on giving--waves of nausea. And, the Puzzler comes to w wordy season finale.
item.title: Car Talk 1026

item.description: Anne in Texas learns not to park her Mazda near a stable at lunch time. Also, an Olds Cutlass owner is advised to go "all additive"; an Audi owner want to consider adding a third foot in lieu of repairs; a mechanic promises eternal engine life with a tachometer; and a marriage counselor sends her client to the wrong guy--Tommy!
item.title: Car Talk 1025

item.description: Ray offers a mea culpa on a recent Puzzler, with a little technical help from Tommy. Then it's off to New Mexico, where Ramey's got crickets under the hood, and to South Dakota, where David's got birds leaving calling card on his truck. Also, how do you tell a know-it-all friend she's rife with bogosity, and why one truck might ride better with a piano on its roof.
item.title: Car Talk 1024

item.description: A Car Talk-style salute to the late Puzzler Master Martin Gardner. Meanwhile, a leaky moon roof becomes a good test of a relationship, as does a Chevy Malibu's passenger seat relocated to the dining room table. Also, the horrible truth about a blast of body odor that only occurs on left turns, and a valuable lesson--before you drive your car from North Carolina to Alaska, learn how to drive it!
item.title: Car Talk 1023

item.description: Did Tom and Ray succeed in keeping Heidi's husband away from the timing belt on her Volvo? Also, A Ford Escort owner wonders if his hang-glider is killing his car's suspension, a Hyundai Sonata doesn't want to leave the gas station, mud-bogging takes its toll on an F-350's steering, and one caller shares a fond childhood memory in hopes of finding out whether his Dad was a complete wacko.
item.title: Car Talk 1022

item.description: Does it bode ill for a marriage's long-term success if the happy couple can't agree on whose car to use to leave the church? Also, the Rental Car Fugitive ponders a confession, a bird researcher seeks an automotive fix for a broken hot water heater, and will $20 buy de-dentification for a Taurus?
item.title: Car Talk 1021

item.description: Our favorite van-dwelling couple, Tara and Curtis, need help resolving a naming dispute over their forthcoming child. Also, proof you really can't trust a used-car salesman, even (or especially) if he's your brother, a son tries to find the line between "good son" and "cheapskate", and a Subaru gives its life to save a neighborhood.
item.title: Car Talk 1020

item.description: Sarah in New Jersey suspects her kids of conducting a peeing contest on her Villager while she was out of town. Find out if the Car Talk Olfactory Forensics Unit can get the kids off the hook. Meanwhile, Ronnie in Florida thinks her husband's full of hot air for suggesting they'll flambe their tuchuses in a black car, Barry in Michigan thinks his Mercedes should be too fast for bugs, and did you hear the one about the parrot and the magician?
item.title: Car Talk 1019

item.description: Courtesy of the Washington Post, a new word that helps explain Tom and Ray's eternal unpenetrability. Also, a marital dispute over patience vs. persistence, Tommy's automotive soul mate reveals herself, and a lesson for shade tree mechanics: unplugging does not equal diagnosing!
item.title: Car Talk 1018

item.description: Do twin brothers working in the same garage have the same auto-diagnostic skills? As one unfortunate caller learns, probably not. Also, is a $10,000 Camaro repair worth doing, if it means also budgeting for a divorce? And, a prank is delivered via Post-It, and on Stump the chumps, was mild mannered Teresa really being trailed by Black Op helicopters?
item.title: Car Talk 1017

item.description: Ray misses a Car Talk staff retreat, but Tom finds a way to make him feel like he was there. Also, is knitting near an airbag a good idea, how to get in trouble with your mother in law in one easy step, can a non-English speaking tennis pro change the timing belt on a Volvo, and does a mid-life crisis car lose its curative pawers if you worry about its roof?
item.title: Car Talk 1016

item.description: Tom and Ray whistle their way through a Mexican graveyard, noting s a few interesting inscriptions along the way. Also, another lesson in why not to ignore your Oil Warning light, how a clerical collar could help compensate for overly aggressive braking, and how do you replace an irreplaceable car?
item.title: Car Talk 1015

item.description: Tom poses the question listeners have been asking for decades--"What are we doing here, anyway?" Happily, Ray is on hand to provide an answer. Also, what do a blower motor in Utah and a spark plug in Connecticut have in common? They both be making unexpected appearances. And, can an odometer really be off by a factor of 10, or does Ruth in Virginia need to have a loooonggg talk with her teenage son.
item.title: Car Talk 1014

item.description: We prepare for baseball season with a few choice quotes from Yogi Berra. Then, we prepare two callers for visits with their loan officers, or the local junkyard. Also, one woman tries to decide which bit of Car Talk wisdom is less lousy, a simple oil change turns into the Worst Day Ever, and is a Honda Civic trying to discourage its owner from moving it from Santa Barbara, CA to Our Fair State?
item.title: Car Talk 1013

item.description: Teresa in Yakima, WA needs help drying her hair during her morning commute. Also, for Adam in Oregon, the price for ignoring a balky transmission and blinking Check Engine light is a few thousand dollars, and ridicule in front of a national audience. Also, Stratus owner Ravi's love is tested by a pending engine rebuild, and Jane in Alabama's not crying over spilled milk, but she is pretty bummed about spilled crem in her husband's BMW.
item.title: Car Talk 1012

item.description: Ed in PA needs help choosing an engine for the airplane he's building in his garage. Do Tom and Ray have enough liability insurance to give him an answer? Also, guilt-racked Cindy worries that she killed her engine driving in a post-carbon monoxide poisoning haze, Sarah in Boston would like her car to be less hospitable to thieves, and less of a target for delivery trucks, and is a trip to the Giggle Hut as healthy as a trip to the gym?
item.title: Car Talk 1011

item.description: How to choose between two mid-life crisis heaps, and keep your wife from knowing about it. Also, an English teacher's plan to treat his students to a recreation of "On the Road" prompts Ray to recall dear old Uncle Dodo; black tape over a Check Engine light fails to solve a fuel problem; a team of janitors take up shop under the floor of a Grand Cherokee; and an offer too good for Tommy to refuse?
item.title: Car Talk 1010

item.description: Familial crises abound, from a daughter leaving Mom's Ford Explorer left running overnight, to a husband unable to wash his wife's Nissan without rendering it unable to start the next day, and a marital disagreement over who owns a freshly shoveled parking space. Also, door locks that don't know when to quit, and a Puzzler from the chicken soup department.
item.title: Car Talk 1009

item.description: We hear from our most astute critics--a class of 8th Graders. Also, a "bogging out" Accord bums out Dad's wallet, a Physics Professor lives on the edge of timing belt disaster, a truck won't stop starting, and on Stump the Chumps, the Good Neighbor policy gets a big test.
item.title: Car Talk 1008

item.description: Did Tom and Ray help dislodge a Mini from a frozen puddle? We find out, as Katie from Boulder returns for Stump the Chumps. Also, a Jeep makes what is most likely the most embarrassing car noise possible, a Chevy owner needs to run red lights to avoid cold air, a couple gets into a heated debate over warming up cars, and how a toothbrush helped start a Mercedes.
item.title: Car Talk 1007

item.description: A Volvo owner's heater problem becomes more acute, due to her dog's flatulence problem. Also, the new owner of a Crown Vic needs help de-copifying his car, a Mom wonders if a blowtorch is the best way to remove a piece of tree bark her son stuck in the driver's door lock, a new word for Subaru drivers, and the number one reason mechanics love Saab owners--they never blink!
item.title: Car Talk 1006

item.description: A used car salesman chooses an opportune moment to become a consumer advocate. Also, a pregnancy induced impulse buy turns into a very large and unreliable gas guzzler the one family member can't even fit in. Plus, how not to fix a vacuum leak if you value your eyebrows, and Tommy gets hit with a flash of brilliance--or idiocy. You decide.
item.title: Car Talk 1005

item.description: A Winter driving tip: don't leave your Mini parked in a slush puddle, unless you want ti find it encased in ice. Also, a simple timing belt repair turns into a scavenger hunt inside the engine of a '96 Civic; an unfortunate oyster shucking incident somehow leads to a new grinding noise in an '01 Escort; and, is a '91 Cougar asking for a bale of hay?
item.title: Car Talk 1004

item.description: A teenager's birthday present for Dad turns the family BMW into a roach coach--literally. Also, on Stump the Chumps, a repair with a very different outcome than we'd imagined; a Golf tries to escape; a Mustang owner looks for a cheap (if not totally ethical) fix for a cracked roof; and, a new career for Tommy?
item.title: Car Talk 1003

item.description: This week on Car Talk, a few choice lines from Rodney Dangerfield set the stage for Sam in Vermont, who's about to learn he has a cracked block--and his car isn't doing so hot, either. Also, a married Dad's need for speed hits a bump in the form of his wife, and Tom and Ray; a Yukon owner tries to convince her Dad and her mechanic that her car really is making a strange noise; and a cardinal becomes overly fond of a Side-view mirror.
item.title: Car Talk 1002

item.description: The Car Talk forensics team tries to help Judith in Virginia figure out why her Mazda burst into flames while driving home for the holidays. Also, will speeding over speed bumps do more damage to a Jeep or the driver's teeth, a backyard clutch replacement gets challenged, and on Stump the Chumps, did someone actually follow Click and Clack's career counseling?
item.title: Car Talk 1001

item.description: What do a tire pressure gauge, a football helmet and a spaceman suit have in common? They're all suggestions from Tom and Ray to help a caller get over his fear of inflating tires. Meanwhile, another caller wonders if jumper cables are overrated after watching a battery-to-battery jumpstart. Also, a Corolla that won't quit--even when its owner wants it to, and a biathlete searches for the perfect $400 car.
item.title: Car Talk 0952

item.description: After three years of parking only in circular driveways, Steve in Florida decides it's time to address (cheaply) the absence of Reverse in his '97 Jetta. Also, a Dad's promise to his soccer star daughter has Mom in a tizzy, a Highlander owner tries to free her stuck-open sunroof from volcanic ash before she has to measure snowfall in the backseat with a meter stick, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0951

item.description: A few songs you likely won't hear this Hanukkah. Also, the morning commute in Louisville gets a lot more interesting, thanks to Bill's loss of brakes; a roll of quarters stages a mass escape into the floor of an Avalon, and why one Jeep owner is especially wary of potholes.
item.title: Car Talk 0950

item.description: Three years after looking for a car for a cross-country road trip, Libbie from Seattle checks in on Stump the Chumps. Did she take Tom and Ray's advice? Was Ray's prophecy that she'd never return to Seattle come true? Also, a gym teacher gets a chance to set a good example for his students, a CRV turns into a Catmobile, and what's considered "high mileage" on a used car?
item.title: Car Talk 0949

item.description: Meet Tom and Ray's new pal, Sal. He's got a Chevy with a problem that can be solved with 1200 dollars, or an early morning call from nature. But it's his voice that truly catches our hosts' fancy. Also, is Grandpa's '72 Dodge worth resuscitating, or should Quentin just take the hat off the dashboard and call it a day? And, if you were searching for an elk-proof car, would a Mini spring to mind?
item.title: Car Talk 0948

item.description: Bad news comes in three's for two callers: Rick, who's had three differentials burst into flames while driving, and Jonathan, who's seen three sparkplugs jump out of his engine. Also, is an open invitation to a car thief the best deterrent, a road-trip turns into a real blowout, and Ray delivers a mea culpa on the now infamous football Puzzler.
item.title: Car Talk 0947

item.description: How big a focus group do you need to consign a car to Dorksville? Is the fact that Mom drives one all the evidence you need? Also, will a facelift rekindle a Volvo owner's passion, is a Summer in Palm Springs hot enough to melt tires, and on Stump the Chumps, was Champagne's rattle really caused by a loose heat shield?
item.title: Car Talk 0946

item.description: Only on Planet Magliozzi would two dreadful diagnoses constitute good news for a Caravan owner. Also, on Stump the Chumps, did Tom and Ray successfully solve Simon's wibbly-wobblies, a Saab turns into a sullen teenager, a Dad wonders if there's a "Hey guys, watch this" gene, and a few things you never heard your mother say.
item.title: Car Talk 0945

item.description: How many thousands of dollars does it take to make the new owner of a classic Jaguar cry, "Uncle!" ? Also, Winterizing 101 for a relocated Professor and her Jetta, a couple debate the best way to escape a "Stinky" on the road, and will Jamie in Nashville still love her Toyota more than her husband when she finds out why it won't go? Also, a new Puzzler from the Perfect Words series, and lots moe.
item.title: Car Talk 0944

item.description: Tommy invokes his marital mantra to helps settle a dispute over burning bugs and a smoking defroster vent. Also, a hairdryer proves to be the crucial piece of evidence in a soggy starting mystery, how to handle an annoying passenger who's also telling everyone you're a lousy driver, and a Hall of Fame worthy display of answer avoidance from Tom and Ray. Plus, a new Puzzler and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0943

item.description: Paging Alfred Hitchcock! A flock of turkeys has gone on the attack against--a Toyota Prius! This week on Car Talk, Tom and Ray try to figure out what's attracting the birds, and what the owner can do to discourage them? Also, three separate car owners with one goal: an encounter with a UPS truck; how to explode a muffler in one easy step; and, on Stump the Chumps, the return of Nunzio the Knucklescraper.
item.title: Car Talk 0942

item.description: A novice hearse owner learns the hard way that his "passenger" compartment doesn't have an exit strategy. Also, a Mercedes owner enjoys a 300 dollar cup of coffee and leaves with the same noise he came in with, a family of 10 goes car shopping, the true cost of home-grown tomatoes, and Ray takes the Puzzler back out on a limb.
item.title: Car Talk 0941

item.description: A Ford Explorer becomes Fido's best friend, after dog food starts spitting out from its AC vents. Also, can Tom and Ray save halibut season on the Homer Spit, by figuring out why Bill's forklift won't start? Plus, over aggressive sap removal exposes a Suburban, a Caravan emits a chirp like clockwork, and the funniest jokes in the world--that we can tell on radio.
item.title: Car Talk 0940

item.description: Is a new Mom's baby soothing technique also a recipe for brake cooking? Also, a resolution to a marital dispute elicits an unexpected response, a college student tries to get the cigarette stink out of his car before Mom and Dad come to visit, and a Suzuki owner stresses over one of the 6,438 noises his car is making. Also, a new Puzzler from the "Loaves and No Fishes" department, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0939

item.description: A couple disagrees over how many headlight bulbs to replace when one burns out. Also, a Civic owner becomes a dry cleaner's best friend after his backseat begins staining all his passengers' pants, a trip to Blockbuster turns death-defying, and a Mercury fights back after becoming a Cash for Clunkers candidate. Also, Opening Day for the new Puzzler season, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0938

item.description: An impulse drive up Lombard Street comes to a smoky conclusion. Also, is a quarter and a roll of tape all you really need to "fix" a cracked windshield? Plus, Stump the Chumps welcomes back Brad, the "walking talking environmental disaster", the Great Brownie-to-Mechanic Ratio debate continues, and stupidity comes to the classroom--literally!
item.title: Car Talk 0937

channel.item:
2009-09-05 19:08:00 -0400 On this week's encore episode, Michelle in Spokane is presented with her dream vehicle--a 1974 Datsun with a missing rear window, holes in the floor, and enough other problems to make her consider sending her dream straight to the crusher. Also, a question of merging etiquette, we gain new respect for the French. and Tommy rants against--perfection. Also, a Jeep that's running too well has an owner seeking euthanasia tips, a Lincoln channels Niagara Falls, Tommy turns into "Henny Magliozzi", and another misdirected birthday cake episode, from the Grammy files. 2009-08-22 19:08:00 -0400 August A daughter's attempt to cure her Dad of one wacko driving habit could open the door to a new one. Also, how a mild-mannered Doctor's BMW became "Noah's Ark of Pestilence", a Saturn indicates a need for Xanax, two friends argue over whether pointing a remote at your chin improves its performance, and a major ethical question is answered--specifically, who gets the brownies? 2009-08-15 19:08:00 -0400 August A Park Ranger's wife seeks an intervention to get her husband to fix the oil leak in his beloved BMW. Also, two cars that call for a redefinition of Cash for Clunkers--a '96 Geo that won't stop, and a '94 Escort that's bid farewell to 5th gear. And, paging Honda of Tiblesi! A CRV owner tries to prepare her car for two years overseas. 2009-08-08 19:08:00 -0400 August A goat rescuer tries to find a way to keep his 4-legged tenants from climbing all over cars--especially the Alfa belonging to his girlfriend. Also, is a planned cross-country drive just a ruse to get a new car? Plus, the nigh Tommy drove on three wheels (don't drive like my brother, indeed!), and, one listener's backhanded plea for hate-mail civility. Car Talk 0932 August https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/111694624/npr_111694624.mp3?e=111694624&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=111694624&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/111694624/npr_111694624.mp3?e=111694624&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=111694624&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer 2009-08-01 19:08:00 -0400 August
2009-08-01 19:08:00 -0400 August One listener presents his case that Tom and Ray are nothing more than a pair of dummies--the wooden kind (at least they could have been made cuter). Also, how can a guy fit into a Dodge, by any means surgical; a dog-owner wonders how to take her car-sick pooch for a test-drive that won't get messy; one man's effort to remain Licenseless in Lincoln; and one way to make public transportation more entertaining. Car Talk 0931 August https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/111462281/npr_111462281.mp3?e=111462281&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=111462281&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer https://play.podtrac.com/npr-510208/edge1.pod.npr.org/anon.npr-podcasts/podcast/510208/111462281/npr_111462281.mp3?e=111462281&t=podcast&p=510208&awEpisodeId=111462281&awCollectionId=510208&sc=siteplayer&aw_0_1st.playerid=siteplayer

item.description: The son of a music legend earns a spot in the "somewhat wacko but probably harmless driving technique" lexicon. Also, should Julie 'fess up to a fender bender, did Denise's impulse auto purchase doom her to misery, and why did Sarah's chicken go for a ride? Also, Mechanic Speak in Translation, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0930

item.description: On this week's encore episode, a Magliozzi family celebration turns into a case of Grand Theft Birthday Cake. Also, a a devoted Minivan Mom finds herself tempted by a seductive Jeep Liberty, a recent college grad wonders how fast he can drive his 1938 Dodge across country, and one caller wonders if her father's trying to tell her subtly that her driving is stinko. All this, plus the most obfuscated Puzzler ever, and more.
item.title: Car Talk 0929

item.description: What's the proper way to thank a mechanic for fixing a problem in 12 seconds, and charging 25 bucks? Also, should a guy who just drove across a stream be more afraid of car damage, or his wife? And, a case of distracted braking leads to cries of "Booooogusss!" All this, some excruciating puns and more, on this week's encore edition.
item.title: Car Talk 0928

item.description: The Van Man winds up being Mr. Right for Tara in Fremont, California, who now seeks guidance for a cross-continent drive. Also, a family Volvo grows ever more hilarious as it becomes ever more difficult to stop, a prank war in Wyoming gets out of hand, and can Tom and Ray solve a problem that has vexed every Honda mechanic in Kansas?
item.title: Car Talk 0927

item.description: A husband seeks helps convincing his wife that a 13 year old, 212,000 mile Tahoe is the perfect ride for their Summer vacation. Also, Nunzio the Knucklescraper takes the car he's fixing for a night on the town and leaves evidence, a '93 Buick evokes fond memories of breakfast, and on Stump the Chumps, the source of a baffling noise is revealed.
item.title: Car Talk 0926

item.description: Loose lugnuts have a Park Ranger checking her list of enemies, but her Dad be the prime suspect. Also, Ray recalls a Commencement foot-in-mouth incident, a caller searches for any Old Wives Tale that'll change his friend's gas habits, and how too much refrigerant can make for a very hot Summer
item.title: Car Talk 0925

item.description: Mathematicians, 4th Graders, and his own brother unite to challenge Ray on a recent Puzzler--who knew there were so many ways to get to 26? Also, a flamenco guitarist who be one turn away from a wheel falling off, and one bouquet away from a restraining order; a forgetful husband who needs to de-stinkify his wife's Camry, and a painful lesson in clutch engagement.
item.title: Car Talk 0924

item.description: A Chevy pickup owner wonders why his tuck runs well only if it's overloaded with 1500 pounds of compost. Meanwhile, a GMC Safari owner searches for the perfect gunk to avoid a transmission rebuild, a whooping Taurus becomes a good relationship tester, and would you trade a pair of busted skis for a 10-year old Jetta that won't shift?
item.title: Car Talk 0923

item.description: Astronaut John Grunsfeld seeks help trying to loosen a calcified bolt from the Hubble Telescope. Also, a 1939 Cadillac Datemobile needs a power boost, a Jetta owner's devotion is tested by a series of unfortunate events, a roadtrip to Mount Rushmore gets muy expensive and we answer the question: Who is Pravo Yasda and why is he getting so many tickets?
item.title: Car Talk 0922

item.description: This week on Car Talk, Tom and Ray's advice helps fix the Hubble Telescope. Plus Ray's new numerical puzzler.
item.title: Car Talk 0921

item.description: What does the Chrysler-Fiat merger really mean? The return of Fiat jokes, of course! Also, a victim of catalytic converter theft explores his options, a Pontiac owner wonders who will look after his Vibe, and why is a '95 Mercedes driving all the cats out of Los Gatos, CA? Also, a new Puzzler from the world of Nouvelle Pneumatics, and lots more
item.title: Car Talk 0920

item.description: Two separate incidents: A bowling sized boulder in Death Valley and a stuck ignition key, elicit the same reaction--a 2-word phase beginning with, "Oh", and ending with a word we can't print here. Also, is 15,000 miles too long between oil changes, even if the car company's paying for it, one teenager gets advice guaranteed to get his parents (and their lawyer) on the phone, and St. Elmo's fire appears on a DC street?
item.title: Car Talk 0919

item.description: On Stump the Chumps, we find out whether a blanket really was the solution to a Subaru's starting problem. Also, why one woman's key ring raised her father's blood pressure, a VW with a little too much get up and go, and will Saab lust come between a woman and her family?
item.title: Car Talk 0918

item.description: A wife worries that her husband's foray into "Procedural Deviancy" croak their car. Also, the car to avoid if you're driving around Cincinnati, a classic case of a car in need of an enema, some trenchant questions from an 11 year old, and late night TV strikes again!
item.title: Car Talk 0917

item.description: A Nissan owner's tire pressure warning light flashes--in front of an NSA building. Can Tom and Ray figure it out, or is this a case for Jack Bauer? Also, a Sebring begins to channel a VW diesel, a Mercedes owner can only laugh at the prospect of a 2,000 dollar brake job, and could a series of problems plaguing a Camry have been avoided by naming the car?
item.title: Car Talk 0916

item.description: Is the price of a new power steering pump worth not having to admit your wife and her ex-boyfriend are right? Also, hungry squirrels choose an unlikely Corolla part as a snack, a caller returns for more buying advice 22 years later, and some thoughts from noted maritotologists Henny Youngman, Rodney Dangerfield, and Rita Rudner.
item.title: Car Talk 0915

item.description: On Stump the Chumps, we find out whether Bill and his Subaru survived Mount Redoubt's eruptions. Also, a spoon prank goes awry in a Grand Am, another reason why you shouldn't trust a mechanic with hairy knuckles, and could a dealer really use feed corn to conceal a failing muffler?
item.title: Car Talk 0914

item.description: A hair-singeing tale that goes beyond Tommy dropping a lit cigarette in his lap. Also, the solution to a stuck key is--yoga? Plus, why the movie classic "Gaslight" be to blame for poor tire pressure, and on Stump the Chumps, one caller plus two problems equals a sweep, a split, or a double drubbing?
item.title: Car Talk 0913

item.description: Title: Everything I Don't Know About Cars, I Learned from Car Talk For all you budding mechanics, a case study in why not to choose Tom and Ray as your mentors. Also, a Toyota owner worries her minivan's tailgate is trying to kill her, why a furniture trip ends with zero couches and two new tires, and we meet Brooklyn gas station attendants' Public Enemy Number 1.
item.title: Car Talk 0912

item.description: Will duct tape and panty hose protect a Subaru from volcanic ash? Does a divorce agreement need to cover the mealworms that have taken residence in a Prius? Also, a quick Latin quiz for the Ides of March, a Jeep sings a sad, familiar song, and an Explorer owner single-handedly be eliminating all the tricycles in her neighborhood.
item.title: Car Talk 0911

item.description: Formerly depressed student Lea checks in to explain why distance from Tom and Ray makes life a whole lot more enjoyable. Also, does a Rabbit diesel need an extra pair of Bronco Nagurskis, did Steve find the missing battery in his Escort, and, what's a mechanic to do when the car he's working on falls off the lift? Find out Ray's response, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0910

item.description: A warm blanket can work wonders, but can it really take credit for starting a Subaru? Also, a game of Hide and Seek with a Ford Escort battery, does motor oil separate a la Paul Newman salad dressing, does a missing tailpipe count as a "necessary repair", and Ray's "near-hernia" experience becomes Puzzler fodder.
item.title: Car Talk 0909

item.description: Daniel Pinkwater's search for a car with "relaxed fit" comes to a happy end. Also, is some out-dated fatherly advice just an attempt to keep his daughter off the road? Plus, why one woman be desperately seeking the most unethical mechanic in Pittsburgh, and, what life-saving words were uttered from the inky shadows of the dimly lit Quonset Hut?
item.title: Car Talk 0908

item.description: Daniel Pinkwater's search for a car with "relaxed fit" comes to a happy end. Also, is some out-dated fatherly advice just an attempt to keep his daughter off the road? Plus, why one woman be desperately seeking the most unethical mechanic in Pittsburgh, and, what life-saving words were uttered from the inky shadows of the dimly lit Quonset Hut?
item.title: Car Talk 0908

item.description: The oft-maligned Car Talk Puzzler hits new poetic heights. Also, a Jeep owner regrets not choosing the "laundry package " option; how many bungee cords equal the cost of a brake job; how do you thaw a frozen convertible top; and, words of wisdom from...Steven Seagal?
item.title: Car Talk 0907

item.description: Is a Saab vs. Suzuki dispute a sign of things to come for a soon to be married couple? Also, how to handle a freshly-shoveled parking spot invader, a 3rd hand starting solution, and the damage done by dirty fingers.
item.title: Car Talk 0906

item.description: 18 years of hauling fish and 6-months as a bat hostel leave an Isuzu with an odor most foul. But, its owner's plan to de-stink it be over the border into Wackoville. Also, a Cadillac engine threatens to run away from home, a dream car needs to stay away from cliffs and could the gas tank of the future be made of mahogany?
item.title: Car Talk 0905

item.description: A bad case of Male Answer Syndrome hits Rochester, New York. Can Tom and Ray help its victim/perpetrator, discreetly? Also, a family of cockroaches hitches a ride in an Accord, a Preacher soon need to really pass the collection plate, and how can warm brownies help thaw a full tub of frozen wiper fluid?
item.title: Car Talk 0904

item.description: A few choice words from Groucho Marx. Also, a caller has more fun on Car Talk than we ever thought possible, can bad homemade wine be re-purposed as wiper fluid, and one man's electric car dream is his wife's nightmare. Also, the Puzzler commemorates the Presidential inauguration, Stump the Chumps, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0903

item.description: Is Detroit desperate enough to take marketing advice from Tom and Ray? If so, the guys have a few ideas to help "move the metal". Also, a 35-minute Windy City warmup, a round of "ABS roulette", and a problem that's too serious for black tape... so bring on the spray paint! And, a new Puzzler from the Dark and Stormy Night series.
item.title: Car Talk 0902

item.description: On this encore episode, could Summer be the cause of a bumpy ride in a 125,000 pound truck at McMurdo Station? Also, is it wise to let sleeping block heaters lie, should you look a gift remote starter in the mouth, and, the results of the First Car Talk Guy Car/Chick Car Survey.
item.title: Car Talk 0901

item.description: An eyewitness account of Ray's short-lived careers as a blizzard chaser. Also, a wet night in a dry wash turns everything inside out for a Camry, a possible case of spousal truck arson, and what could make Tommy say, "He's doing pretty good, but for the wackiest reasons I've ever heard!"
item.title: Car Talk 0852

item.description: A 3-year old, a golfball, and the tailpipe of a Toyota Highlander come together, resulting a very nervous Dad. Also, Ray revives his proposal for a national gas tax, an all-mouse production of The Nutcracker Meets La Boheme takes the stare in an Element, and how NOT to keep a loved one from flying through the windshield.
item.title: Car Talk 0851

item.description: As if lousy advice wasn't bad enough, have we resorted to adding a "Snort Track" to the show? Also, a Doctor's Lincoln starts to remind him of his mother, why new tires can be shocking, and a guy who can even out-laugh us.
item.title: Car Talk 0850

item.description: After four years, a New Yorker tires of "creative" parallel parking, and wonders why his Jetta won't go in reverse. Also, a novice driver looks for the perfect car--small, cute, safe, reliable...and cheaper than 5,000 bucks. Can Tom and Ray stop laughing long enough to suggest anything? And, on Stump the Chumps, an unwelcome neighbor departs.
item.title: Car Talk 0849

item.description: A college student pleads for help navigating the existential crisis known as Freshman year. Also, a truck owner tries to get her faithful pooch to ride somewhere other than the roof of her truck, and a not so mysterious coolant mystery. Encore episode.
item.title: Car Talk 0848

item.description: Field research confirms a strange attraction to our show among...sheep! Also, two callers learn they're a day late a few quarts short of some expensive repairs, an unloved Beetle finds a new home while it's former owner finds lower blood pressure, and a clown car doesn't know when to stop running.
item.title: Car Talk 0847

item.description: This week on Car Talk, a list of rejected Doctoral Dissertation topics. And Tom and Ray help one caller find the cause of his engine fires. Watch out... it might bite you!
item.title: Car Talk 0846 Show#0846

item.description: Is a gentle toot the best way to let a fellow driver know he's done a bad thing, or should you just let it be? Also, a tropical storm- plagued Miata, a Subaru with "squirrels in the blender syndrome", one listener's alarming parking fixation, and what do you do when your mechanic's hearing loss could mean your engine loss?
item.title: Car Talk 0845

item.description: Thieves break into a Ford Focus and make off with nothing but the owner's manual. Also, a would be shade-tree mechanic prepares to jump in, with his pals Stumpy and Meat by his side, a repair that could make a car stop running altogether, and Car Talk's new listener demographic--we"re going ovine!
item.title: Car Talk 0844

item.description: A family tries to turn their Dad's beloved car into a shrine. Also, a Miata owner considers looking a gift Camry in the mouth, a Plymouth van starts percolating, and why shakes, rattles, and rolls are what Jeep ownership's all about. Plus, a new Puzzler, and some new models that be coming to a Chryotors dealership near you.
item.title: Car Talk 0843

item.description: Winter draws closer, and the good folks of Tofte, Minnesota are in a dispute over how best to orient a snowplow. And, for some reason, they think Tom and Ray will be able to help. Also, a Chevy Venture groans, even in its off hours, a Highlander driver need to bolt her kitchen seat in, and why is a Mini resembling a tossed salad?
item.title: Car Talk 0842

item.description: An abandoned Nissan takes residence on a Staten Island street--who better to advise on how to get rid of it than Tom and Ray? Also, why a Subaru should not be mistaken for a sardine can, how a Honda magically turned into a Town and Country, and can the words "perfectly safe" be used in the same sentence as "66 MG"?
item.title: Car Talk 0841

item.description: This week, the Magliozzi mantra for handling any customer service nightmare. Also, an update from the VW van dweller, a warning light that can hibernate for the Winter, and is there such a thing as a "diginifed" fart? Plus, a new Puzzler from the Travel and Leisure series, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk 0840

item.description: He's a med student, good looking, and eats with minimal grunting--so why is Tara in California concerned about her new boyfriend? Could it be that his choice of domicile is an '86 VW van? Also, the fuel line (wallet) flush pitch appears at "Fanny's Parasol Barbosh", a Nissan owner suffers horn envy, and why would a clutch get depressed at 2,000 feet?
item.title: Car Talk 0839

item.description: Tom and Ray referee a couple's auto-relational dispute over when to shift their Scion XA. Also, field research on the "getting the last drop" gas station strategy, a poorly steered answer on Stump the Chumps, and a new Puzzler from the "Dining with the Magliozzis" series.
item.title: Car Talk 0838

item.description: A new Prius owner worries that he have accidentally stepped into the wrong gender. Also, the worst place in the world to learn to drive a stick shift, a Civic develops agorophobia in its garage, and the Puzzler returns!
item.title: Car Talk 0837

channel.item:

Also, Stump the Chumps tests the relationship between Lillian and her mechanic Bobby; a husband wonders how to stop his wife from killing Fords, and a really dirty fuel flush scam. 2008-08-10 19:08:00 -0400 August When a relationship ends, who get to keep taking their car to the trusty mechanic? Also, why a smoking Jetta is just like a Magliozzi, a truck sends Tom and Ray into Duck and Cover mode, and more thoughts on the legendary Andy letter. 2008-08-02 19:08:00 -0400 August A listener thanks Tom and Ray for inadvertently solving a decades-old philosophical question. item.description: A driver wonders if she should fess up for skipping a toll she didn't have Exact Change for, but, she have no choice, thanks to Tom and Ray. Also, is all fair and love and grease? How to win a mechanic's heart. And, welcome to the world of electric brakes.
item.title: Car Talk 0830

item.description: An all-time classic Shaggy Dog story--literally. Also, Ray's misadventure on the exercise bike; a wife searches for a low-decibel strategy to keep her husband from driving off the road; a Buick that drinks oil faster than its owner can drink beer; and, we meet the Chuck Yeager of CV Joints?
item.title: Car Talk 0829

item.description: Tommy reminisces about his days in the U.S. Army, especially the one in which he rose to the rank of Private. Also, why a Volvo owner wish she'd married a gecko, and what happens when you give a 3-year old a golf ball and put him near your exhaust pipe? Yep, you guessed right.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0828

item.description: A lesson in how NOT to let off steam after a marital tiff. Also, two women's worst nightmares: one is gonna be stuck with her '87 Camry a little longer, and the other has to face the fact that her husband was right about a clogged AC. And, why you should never trust a mechanic who keeps his boat parked near his garage.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0827

item.description: Tom and Ray's thoughts on the passing of comedian and longtime Car Talk Plaza hero, George Carlin. Also, would you pay 700 bucks just to get some really bad news? Plus, a joyride IN a warehouse jeopardizes a Suzuki Swift, and straight outta the Witness Protection program in Twin Falls, our pal Dino returns for Stump the Chumps.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0826

item.description: A frustrated VW owner plans a less-than fond farewell to her Beetle. Also, the victim of sibling-induced timing chain obsession seeks guidance, Scooby Doo appears in a PT Cruiser, and would you share your wedding vows with a '61 Corvair Greenbrier?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0825

item.description: A "foreign body" finds its way itno a Land Rover's differential. Fortunately, it's inanimate. Also, advice to mechanics: don't tell a customer complaining about noisy brakes that the problem is hormonal. And, a Dad gives his daughter useful automotive advice that could land them both in jail.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0824

item.description: 83-year old Lillian gets a fishy-sounding diagnosis on her Lincoln, and turns to Tom and Ray for guidance. They decide to play "60 Minutes", and go right to the source. Also, our on-call Physicist explains how the guys got their heads up their keisters on head-on collisions, a new Puzzler, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0823

item.description: Tom and Ray Magliozzi of Car Talk answer callers questions about their cars from sticky brakes and faulty starters, to marital disputes and an ethical puzzler.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0822

item.description: A boyfriend's surprise car wash gets him in hot water. Also, a friendly family debate over--what's the most damaging kind of car crash. Plus, a backfire has a woman eyeing her husband differently, and how do you fix your carburetor when you don't have one?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0821

item.description: A huband plans to convert his wife's minivan to hydrogen power--she looks to Tom and Ray to talk some sense into him. Bad idea. Also, one car fire our hosts didn't cause, the sound of a transmission kapuit-ing, and one man finds his soulmate--a '62 Austin.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0820

item.description: A restitution offer is received--but, is it accepted? Also, can selective blinker use ruin an otherwise perfect relationship, and, how not to make friends with your neighbor.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0819

item.description: An innocent Porsche begins rolling towards a cliff--backwards and uphill. Is there an explanation aside from the fact it's in the aptly named town of "Radium Springs" ? Also, "foreign accent syndrome" takes on a new dimension, when not to use "belt dressing", and two callers get homework assignments.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0818

item.description: Ray's inadvertent hijacking of Grammy's birthday cake (She Show #0813) opens the auto-confessional door. If you've ever cooked a friend's car, here's an opportunity to make amends. ?lso, a Kia owner cooks her own car, and we hear the evidence. And, does drafting to save gas cost the draftee anything?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0817

item.description: How a long flight to Iceland, and an overdose of lutefisk helped create a new addition to the Car Talk lexicon. Also, the new owner of a Ford pick-up discovers a bonus gas tank he be better off using for hamburgers, a new Dad wonders why his wife won't let him take baby for a ride in his Jag, and a Cabrio owner wonders why her shoulder's all wet.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0816

item.description: An encore show featuring stories about one of Tom and Ray's oldest (and loudest) friends. Also, a lesson in windhshield wiper fluid dynamics that violates most, if not all, laws of physics; another way to drive your wife crazy; And, the introduction of a new high-level auto-technical term: "Shmutz on the Clutch". (Note: includes the phrase" chicken asses")
item.title: Car Talk Show #0815

item.description: A husband raises the stakes in a marital dispute over an over-populated key ring. Also, an '02 Nissan with almost 600,000 miles gets clogged, a Volvo owner enjoys life without a muffler, and is the Autobahn really the place to break in a new BMW? Pluse, new hope for ugly guys! Within reason, of course.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0814

item.description: A soccer Mom develops an obsession with a potential new ride. Also, how the Tom Magliozzi Principle can guide a cross-country drive in a 1938 Dodge, a Dad shares his dream of handing down a '92 Subaru--in 2019, and Ray's son has a terrific birthday--at someone else's expense.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0813

item.description: Dad's dream car becomes his daughter's nightmare. Can Tom and Ray help her find her way out of a luxury car she's not ready for? Also, we meet the most unlikely resident of Twin Falls, Idaho; a Volvo sounds a tornado warning, and can you trust your brother, even if he's a mechanic?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0812

item.description: A musician searches for a creative (cheap) fix to a noisy exhaust. Also, the Wisdom of Homer, a very expensive clogged drain, and on Stump the Chumps--Ray stands alone. Will he have the last laugh?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0811

item.description: A new Mom faces a driver's door that won't open, and a passenger door that won't close. Her response? A bungee cord and a good laugh. Find out if Tom and Ray can do any better. Also, a faulty gas cap brings out the guys' inner 6th graders, a plow truck channels Popeye, and why one woman has turned her daily commute into a deluxe tour of New Haven.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0810

item.description: A Volvo owner is vexed by a noise she can't hear, a Mom and her 14 year old son argue over what's ailing her Kia, and the adventure of a lifetime: going 300 miles to pick up your new Suzuki? Also, the Washington Post helps answer the question: How do you know if you're a loser (aside from listening to Car Talk)?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0809

item.description: The great Lost Saab Key crisis in Norfolk, MA has a happy ending, on Stump the Chumps. Also, Dad and son bond over wacking the bejeebers out of a Civic CV Joint, a Forester owner ponders life without 5th gear, and, if you're searching for a time machine, look no further!
item.title: Car Talk Show #0807

item.description: A long-distance relationship is put to the test by one half's inability to drive. Also, if your hear takes you to Alaska, can your Maxivan follow? And,a re the words, "Yes, dear" the secret to a happy marriage?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0807

item.description: Ray recalls one of his all-time favorite customers, the legendary "Heavy Duty". Also, has a beloved CRX turned into a chick repellant for single guy Glenn? Why is a Massachusetts town in red alert over a mlost Saab key? And, does a Passat get to share in a family's Alaskan adventure?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0806

item.description: On Stump the Chumps, find out of Tom and Ray successfully decoded one of the most baffling noises to ever confront them. Also, is a car a bad subsitute for a crib? Do Minis eat clutches for lunch? And, just when you think you've seen all kinds of distracted driving, have we got a story for you!
item.title: Car Talk Show #0805

item.description: A Winter dilemma shared by many--why do you get a shock when you touch your car after driving? Also, a solution to another Winter scourge--frozen door locks. Plus, a couple of vintage VW owners headed to Craig's List, and when NOT to change your oil.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0804

item.description: A new Mom seeks help keeping her baby warm in her car, and gets a lot more advice than she asked for. Also, a Honda that should stay away from farm animals, a Dodge Caravan key acquires mysterious powers, and a Ford Falcon owner tries to say farewell.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0803

item.description: What fun is a vintage car if your kids have to get out and push you up hills? The owner of a '57 Morris Minor wonders if he can cram a few more horses under the hood. Also, is a 40,000 dollar Audi really not "car wash ready"? And, the usual assortment of odd noises, wacko remedies, and wheels on the verge of falling off.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0802

item.description: A new Mom of floats a really bad idea for keeping the kids entertained--putting a heap in the backyard. Also, the fate of a marrage rest on whether Topm and Ray can diagnose a starting problem, and what's a guy to do when his rental car bursts into flames?
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0801

item.description: Tom and Ray answer personal questions from listeners, including, "Why don't you look like you sound?" Also, a guy thinks his T-Bird is making him stupid, and what do you do with a truck that you look great sitting in, except when it's on fire?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0752

item.description: What's an 82 year old woman to do when her 18 year old car is taking on more water than the Titanic? Tom and Ray have a solution--open her son's wallet for a new set of wheels. Also, a new use for a seatbelt and a really bad way to clean a windshield.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0751

item.description: What's a Suzuki owner to do when Jesus seems to make an appearance on her rear windshield? Also, the plural car model Puzzler retuens--again, an Eclipse gets hot and bothered at Burger King, and what's the fastest way to heat a chilly car?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0750

item.description: A listener finds the man of her dreams in a car that's a nightmare. Also, what to do when all you have left is your gas tank, we debunk the Key Hokey-Pokey, and the Chinese food delivery guy makes a cameo appearance.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0749

item.description: A recent Puzzler breaks the all-time record for bogosity. Also, The Washington Post tries to stump us, Tom and Ray recommend AGAINST a duct tape fix, and a Ford F-150 goes for a very slow midnight ride.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0748

item.description: A cautionary tale for frustrated shade tree mechanics--be sure to choose the right caliber. Also, Stump the Chumps ponders, when is a thunk not a thunk? A weekend mountain getaway goes awry, and windshield wipers gone wild!
item.title: Car Talk Show #0747

item.description: Necessity is the mother of invention? Two 8-year olds develop an anti-wedgie deense system. Also, the correct way to use your wallet to diagnose a scary noise, the optimal speed for good gas mileage, and a concrete way to keep your teenage driver from hauling around her entire high school class?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0746

item.description: A retired soldier enters marital Basic Training, and fhis beloved truck has failed inspection. Can Tom and Ray help him find a new ride? Also, meatloaf a la manifold, and Car Talk ruins an otherwise perfect vacation. Plus, a new Puzzler, and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0745

item.description: A post-jumpstart electrical breakdown puts a strain on a friendship--can Tom and Ray restore harmony? Also, a 30-year obsession with tire pressure gets closure, we hope. And, has an "old-fashioned Russian" uncovered the great Oil Change Conspiracy?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0744

item.description: A classic Car Talk listener conundrum takes on new significance. Also, a Novena for Nolina at the altar of Barsleak? And, Grandma's Olds threatens a marriage. Plus, a new Puzzler and Stump the Chumps.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0743

item.description: The owner/resident of a Chevy van asks for help with a stalling problem, and winds up in the middle of an on-air repair project. Also, the joy of whacking your shifter, and would you like your brakes on hangers, and with or without starch?
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0742

item.description: A guilt-wracked sister asks Tom and Ray to help her fess up to her brother about his beloved truck. Also, a new Mini with a small problem--it occasionally stops moving, who owns the center console, and a retired meatman arms himself with a spray can--can any good come of that?
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0741

item.description: Two clowns try to help a third, as IRS agent/Shriner Clown "Looney" asks Tom and Ray how to double-clutch his '29 Ford. Also, a new Puzzler, and a recurring case of 40,000 mile flatulence.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0740

item.description: Tom and Ray save a family road trip from disaster, in an unexpected way. Also, repair by Dixie cup, and how not to hurt Grandma's feelings.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0739

item.description: A Toyota of many noises causes a sibling dispute. Find out if peace reign at Car Talk Plaza. Also, the need for men to do stupid things, and the Puzzler returns to Horsetown.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0738 (corrected)

item.description: A 4-Runner of many noises causes a sibling dispute. Find out if peace reign at Car Talk Plaza. Also, the need for men to do stupid things, and the Puzzler returns to Horsetown.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0738

item.description: Listeners weigh in on the great car naming debate. Also, a wild ride down Mount Saint Helens, and the return of the Puzzler.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0737

item.description: Ther auto add-on market hits a new high--in uselessnes. Also, a case of unintinded seat-warmer activation, and Stump the Chumps.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0736

item.description: This week's show features one of our all-time classic calls, from Dave in Bemidji, Minnesota. Find out how a barbecue grill helped save his Cavalier. Also, some shocking truths about lying, what every student really needs this year, and, why you shouldn't trust a stuck glove compartment door to Helmut.
item.title: Car Talk : Show #0730

item.description: A classic show from our archives, featuring one of our all-time favorite calls: Christy and her Dad. Did she destroy his Citation 15 years ago? Also, A Taurus renders Viagra unnecessary in Silver Spring, and how many rocks equal a Mother in Law?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0729

item.description: This week on Car Talk: Are older brothers really smarter? Not according to younger brother Ray. And we hear about strangled cats, diamond mines and the dog who ate a Lexus.
item.title: Car Talk , Show # 0728

item.description: Are car salesmen unfairly stereotyped? Tom and Ray tackle this and other weighty questions, such as: What's that sulphur smell? How can Katherine make up for rear ending her boss's car? Is 12 years too late to bring your car in for a recall? All this and more on this week's Car Talk.
item.title: Car Talk , Show # 0727

item.description: Tom and Ray answer personal questions from listeners. Were the brothers ever wedgie victims? And whos' behind the trademark Car Talk snort? Also, mechanics joyriding in Lance's Lumina, the pitfalls of not cleaning off your wiper blades, a new puzzler and lots more.
item.title: Car Talk , Show #0726

item.description: This week on Car Talk, our humble additions to the Pope's 10 Commandments for motorists. Also, a search for wayward jelly beans, why a fluid change be best left for after Thanksgiving, and the Wheel of Misfortune gets frozen out.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0725

item.description: This week on Car Talk, we meet the self-proclimaed "Dr. Granola", who's looking for any way to avoid opening his wallet to fix the AC in his Lincoln. Also, a wife complains that her husband's making her feel like Job on their road trips, and in search of the perfect wine tour-bus--but, if you do enough wine touring, does the bus really matter?
item.title: Car Talk Show #0724

item.description: In time for Father's Day, Tom and Ray share a couple of stories about theie dear old Dad. Also, the hacksaw repair strategy strikes again, a dutiful girlfriend suffers unneeded guilt, a yarn of a new Puzzler, and, the Chinese food delivery guy makes a cameo!
item.title: Car Talk Show #0723

item.description: Fans of auto-noise reenactments, rejoice! Have we got a doozy for you. Also, an ABS tutorial, a Saab that will take 35 dollars of gas--no more, no less--and how cars are handed down from one generation to the next in the Mgaliozzi household.
item.title: Car Talk Show #0722

item.description: Ray's misadventure with Sno-Seal prompts listeners to share their own medicine cabinet mishaps. Also, what to do when your car turns into a mouse's pantry, a very scary ride in an Escape, and a bit of maternal history from Tom and Ray.
item.title: Car Talk

item.description: Does automotive fidelity equal marital fidelity? Also, A Honda that be ready for Rogaine, A Volvo owner wonders if he can live without a part he never knew he had, a new automotive Puzzler, and lots nore.
item.title: Car Talk

item.description: A collection of Car Talk appearances featuring their long-suffering Mom, Elizabeth Magliozzi. Find out whether she knows as much about parenting as they do about cars...and, where the guys learned to laugh.
item.title: Car Talk : Hello You're on Mom Talk!

item.description: An ill-fated trip to the Big City for Sid and his Mulchmobile. Also, an Alfa owner wants to give her car a homecoming, but, have to ditch her self-appointed interpereters. And, a single Mom searches for her dream car: reliable, safe, fuel efficient, and snazzy--for under 12 grand.
item.title: Car Talk
